diagnosis.primary: Squamous Cell Carcinoma (SCCa), Poorly Differentiated, with Perineural Invasion (PNI)
diagnosis.priorTreatmentSummary: Wide local excision with involved margins (02/15/2025).

treatmentPlan.targetVolumeSummary: PTV encompassing the post-operative scalp bed with generous margin (~2-3 cm) due to PNI/margins.
medications: Topical steroid cream PRN extensive dermatitis

ctSimulation.setupInstructions: Supine with head immobilized in a custom thermoplastic mask. SAD/SSD setup depending on field.
ctSimulation.referenceMarks: Mask marks aligned to room lasers for daily setup.
ctSimulation.contrastUsed: IV Contrast (to evaluate for deep extension on sim scan)
ctSimulation.ctNotes: CT acquired for planning of complex abutting fields. Fused with diagnostic MRI. Wires placed to delineate surgical bed and margins.

dosimetry.norm: Varies by field (e.g., Isocenter for photons, Dmax for electrons)
dosimetry.planNotes: Complex abutting electron/photon fields post-op. Careful junction planning to avoid hot/cold spots.

fractions.setupNotes: Daily setup to mask marks. kV imaging for photon field. Clinical check for electron fields. Bolus applied.
fractions.sideEffects: Moderate erythema (Grade 1-2) across entire scalp field. Mild tenderness.
fractions.notes: Patient managing skin care well with recommended creams.

imagingAndReports.summary: ~10cm area SCCa, poorly diff, extensive PNI. Margins involved focally.
Post-operative changes L scalp. No definite intracranial extension or skull base involvement noted. Useful for defining deep extent for RT planning.
CT acquired in thermoplastic mask. Wires outlining surgical bed/margins. Fused with MRI.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Elizabeth Chen (Derm)
progressNotes.summary: Pt s/p wide excision L scalp SCCa. Pathology shows extensive PNI and close/positive margins. High risk lesion. Urgent referral to Rad Onc for adjuvant RT.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Brian Carter (Rad Onc)
progressNotes.summary: Pt referred for adjuvant RT for high-risk L scalp SCCa s/p excision. Exam shows large post-op site vertex/temporal. Reviewed path/MRI. Plan for adjuvant RT to 60Gy/30fx. Discussed complex setup requiring abutting fields (likely electron/photon combo) to cover area while sparing brain. Explained SEs (severe skin rxn, hair loss, fatigue). Pt agrees. CT sim scheduled.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Brian Carter (Rad Onc)
progressNotes.summary: Treatment plan finalized. Will use a combination of electron and photon fields to optimize coverage while minimizing dose to underlying brain tissue. Bolus will be used to increase the dose to the skin surface.

progressNotes.author: RN Jane Doe
progressNotes.summary: Patient tolerated treatment well. Skin reaction is minimal at this point. Continue to monitor for any signs of discomfort.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Brian Carter (Rad Onc)
progressNotes.summary: Patient completed the treatment course. Skin reaction is within expected limits. Will follow up in one month.

patientEducation.goalsDiscussed: Adjuvant (post-operative) radiation to reduce the high risk of cancer recurrence on the scalp due to positive margins and perineural invasion.
patientEducation.sideEffectsReviewed: A significant skin reaction over the large treated area is expected (severe redness, peeling, moist desquamation). Permanent hair loss in the treated area is certain. Fatigue. Low risk of long-term skin changes or other issues.
patientEducation.safetyConsiderations: Meticulous scalp care (gentle washing, prescribed creams). Protecting the scalp from sun exposure indefinitely. Reporting any signs of skin infection.
patientEducation.patientResponsibilities: Attend daily RT. Perform skin care as instructed. Maintain good hydration and nutrition.
patientEducation.medicationCompliance: Use topical creams and pain medication as directed.

cptCharges.description: Radiation treatment delivery, superficial and/or ortho voltage
